title: Tired of Being Sorry
name: Tired of Being Sorry
description:
A Map by Sleepyfroggie

Here are the places we went, that mean so much to me.  No more apologies - just great memories of you.

Here's to the good times to come!

properties.name: Al Gelato
properties.description: Posted by Sleepyfroggie806 S. Robertson Blvd., Los Angeles, CAAt the upscale end of Robertson sits a quaint Italian ice-cream parlor where a friendly waitstaff helps you indulge your sweet tooth and savory cravings.

properties.name: Border Grill
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler 1445 4th Street, santa monica caBorder Grill is the vibrant setting where Chefs Mary Sue Milliken and Susan Feniger, Food Network’s “Too Hot Tamales”, present the bold foods and flavors of Mexico. The Santa Monica-based restaurant serves upscale, modern Mexican food in a hip, urban cantina with decor as wild and bright as a fiesta. Border Grill has established a new standard for gourmet Mexican fare in Los Angeles and consistently ranks among the L.A. Times’ top restaurants. It has also been named “One of the Best Restaurants in America” by Gourmet.

properties.name: Busby's Restaurant Bar
properties.description: Posted by Sleepyfroggie  3110 Santa Monica Boulevard, Santa Monica, CA, 90404Westside sports bar buzzes with big-game fever, sizzling singles and tasty eats.

properties.name: Cafe Bleu
properties.description: Posted by Sleepyfroggie 3470 W. 6th St., Los Angeles, CA

properties.name: Coachella
properties.description: Posted by Sleepyfroggie  81-800 Avenue 51 Indio CA

properties.description: Posted by Sleepyfroggie11208 Culver Blvd., Culver City, CA

properties.name: Grauman's Chinese Theater
properties.description: Posted by Sleepyfroggie 6925 Hollywood Blvd., Hollywood, CA

properties.name: Hide Sushi
properties.description: Posted by Sleepyfroggie2040 Sawtelle Blvd., Los Angeles, CANo fuss, just fish at this neighborhood favorite get-it-to-go sushi spot.

properties.name: Huntley Hotel
properties.description: Posted by Sleepyfroggie 1111 2nd St., Santa Monica, CAThis penthouse bar boasts spectacular, sweeping views of the Pacific Ocean by day, and the sparking city lights of Santa Monica and Malibu at night.

properties.name: Manhattan Beach Creamery
properties.description: Posted by Sleepyfroggie   1120 Manhattan Avenue, Manhattan Beach, CAWelcome to Manhattan Beach Creamery. We are an old-fashioned ice cream parlor, nestled by the beach in southern California, making and serving super premium ice cream, homemade on the premises. Our goal is to make having an ice cream a fun experience for all your family in our Cape Cod style store. We also cater children\'s parties on the premises - please check our parties page to learn how we can make your child\'s party an unforgettable experience. The creamery also supports a full production facility. We can develop, produce and distribute a complete line of super premium ice cream to your specifications.

properties.name: McCabe's Bar & Grill
properties.description: Posted by Sleepyfroggie2455 Santa Monica Blvd., Santa Monica, CAMcCabe\'s simple, one-room layout features a duo of pool tables to the left, a scattering of tables and chairs to the right, and a line of demarcation down the center set by a wooden partition. The old-school bar stretches across the back, flanked by suspended TVs at each end. Several beers on tap and in bottles, as well as cocktails and wine, are available. For eats, the traditional American menu offers appetizers, burgers, sandwiches and salads.

properties.name: Paramount Lot
properties.description: Posted by Sleepyfroggie5555 Melrose Ave., Hollywood, CA

properties.name: Santa Anita Racetrack
properties.description: Posted by Sleepyfroggie285 W. Huntington; Arcadia, CA

properties.name: The Well
properties.description: Posted by Sleepyfroggie6255 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles CAWhen the coziest lounge in Hollywood fills to capacity every night, what are the owners to do? Open up a new bar with a swankier vibe right around the corner, of course. Within walking distance of Daddy\'s, the Well maintains the sexy atmosphere of its predecessor, but adds a shot of sophistication. Keyhole doorways, intimate booths and cushy seating against one wall encourage a let\'s-get-to-know-each-other mood. Making new friends is easy because the jukebox volume is set low enough so you can actually hear what you\'re saying. Good thing, since it can be quite a mood-breaker when the songs switch from Sinatra to N.W.A. Get there early to pick your own soundtrack and order some finger food. Stick around when they dim the lights and you won\'t make it home until last call.

properties.name: lounge 217
properties.description: Posted by Sleepyfroggie217 Broadway, Santa Monica, CANo sign and no light bulbs make this Santa Monica lounge the perfect place for romance on the hush-hush.
